summary: John J. Moriarty was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports that list Moriarty's name, salary, and employment dates. He was employed by the HSCA at least from April 1978 to December 1978. The documents do not specify his exact role within the committee, but his presence on payroll suggests he held a staff position.
significance: John J. Moriarty's significance lies in his employment with the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), the body tasked with investigating the JFK assassination. While the specific nature of his role is not detailed in these documents, his employment contributes to the overall staffing and operation of the committee during its investigation.
